timings: Typically open during daytime; specific galleries & timings vary — Not documented (standard museum hours often ~10:00–17:00; check official before visit).
entry_fee: Not documented (museum ticketing varies by gallery & concessions).
best_time: October–March (pleasant weather; ideal for outdoor garden strolls and evening light & sound shows).
nearest_railway: Kolkata (Sealdah) / Howrah Junction (approx. 7–10 km to site depending on station).
nearest_bus: Esplanade / Eden Gardens bus stops (approx. 1–3 km).
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport (approx. 18–22 km).
accessibility: Urban roads to site; paved paths and ramps in public areas but check specific gallery accessibility for wheelchairs.
guided_tours: Guided tours and audio guides often available; city guides offer structured tours.
parking: On-site/nearby parking in Kolkata; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Cafes, restaurants, hotels (Park Street area), restrooms, souvenir shops.
special_notes: Iconic British-era monument with large surrounding gardens and evening light & sound shows; central Kolkata cultural landmark.

timings: Public road bridge — open 24 hours.
entry_fee: Free (road crossing).
best_time: October–March (pleasant weather; good for riverfront walks and sunset photography).
nearest_railway: Howrah Junction (adjacent, ~0–1 km).
nearest_bus: Howrah Bus Stand / Esplanade buses via ferry (approx. 1–3 km).
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport (approx. 20–25 km).
metro_station: Howrah Maidan / Esplanade access via Kolkata metro network (approx. 2–3 km).
accessibility: Road access; pedestrian pathways present though crowded; wheelchair access on approach roads but crowded footpaths may limit comfort.
guided_tours: Not applicable; city walking/photography tours include the bridge.
parking: Nearby parking in Howrah/Kolkata; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Ferry ghats, food stalls, Kolkata waterfront promenades, hotels.
special_notes: One of Kolkata’s most recognized symbols — dramatic views of the Hooghly River and the Kolkata waterfront.

timings: Temple darshan timings vary (early morning to late evening); exact hours: Not documented.
entry_fee: Free for darshan; specific offerings/donations possible — Not documented.
best_time: Oct–Mar (festivals, pleasant weather); Kali Puja/Dussehra draw big crowds.
nearest_railway: Dakshineswar railway station / Belgharia (approx. 1–4 km).
nearest_bus: Dakshineswar Bus Stop (close by, <1 km).
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport (approx. 18–25 km).
metro_station: No direct metro to the immediate ghat (Kolkata Metro via Dum Dum / Phoolbagan requires road transfer) — local transit available.
accessibility: Well-connected by road and ferry; steps to ghats and temple areas — partial wheelchair access limited by crowds and steps.
guided_tours: Priests/temple guides and local guides available; many heritage walks include Dakshineswar.
parking: Local parking near temple complex; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Ghats, ferry services to Belur Math, eateries, stalls, restrooms.
official_website: Not official — temple trust pages & tourism portals cover it.
special_notes: Prominent 19th-century Kali temple associated with mystic Ramakrishna; busy pilgrimage site with cultural & spiritual significance.

timings: Not documented here (museum typical hours ~10:30–17:00; check official for current timings).
entry_fee: Not documented (museum fees vary by category).
best_time: Oct–Mar (comfortable city touring weather).
nearest_railway: Sealdah (approx. 2–4 km) / Howrah via road (longer).
nearest_bus: Museum Bus Stop / Esplanade (approx. 0–2 km).
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport (approx. 20–25 km).
accessibility: Urban location; some old-building constraints for full wheelchair access — check museum for current facilities.
guided_tours: Guided tours and docent services may be available—school/group tours common.
parking: Nearby city parking; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Park Street eateries, hotels, cafes, restrooms.
special_notes: One of India’s oldest and largest museums with archaeology, anthropology, meteorology, and numismatics collections.

category: Wildlife Sanctuary / Mangrove Forest / Biosphere Reserve
timings: Boat safaris/day trips typically run during daylight; park/safari timings and boat schedules seasonal — check official tour operators.
entry_fee: Not documented (park permits, guide/boat charges, and eco-tour fees applicable — vary by operator).
best_time: September–March (post-monsoon to winter — safer and best for wildlife & boat safaris).
nearest_railway: Canning Railway Station (approx. 40–50 km to entry points like Godkhali/Najirgaon depending on route).
nearest_bus: Kolkata bus routes to Godkhali / Sonakhali / Namkhana (distances vary by entry point).
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport, Kolkata (approx. 80–110 km depending on launch point).
metro_station: No metro available to the Sundarbans; reach Kolkata and then road/rail to gateway towns.
accessibility: Only accessible by boat/launch inside the mangroves; reachability depends on tide & weather; not wheelchair friendly in interior zones; forest department-managed zones have restricted access.
guided_tours: Guided/jungle cruises by authorized operators; West Bengal Tourism organizes guided tours from Kolkata; forest department permit & guide required for core zones.
parking: Park at gateway ghats/launch points (Godkhali/Hasnabad/Namkhana); parking at gateway towns — charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Eco-tourism lodges, guest houses near launch points; limited amenities inside; basic provisions at entry towns.
special_notes: World’s largest mangrove ecosystem and UNESCO biosphere (Sundarbans Tiger Reserve); home of Royal Bengal tiger, estuarine crocodiles, migratory birds; travel is tide/weather dependent and regulated.

place_name: Darjeeling (Tiger Hill, Batasia Loop, Darjeeling Himalayan Railway)
category: Hill Station / Scenic Viewpoints / Heritage Railway / Tea Estates
timings: Tiger Hill sunrise visits early morning; Batasia Loop generally open 06:00–17:00; many attractions open daylight hours — check local sources.
entry_fee: Batasia Loop small entry fee (~₹20 reported by local sources); other sites vary.
best_time: March–May and Oct–Nov (spring/clear skies & autumn for views of Kanchenjunga); winter offers views but cold.
nearest_railway: New Jalpaiguri (NJP) for long-distance trains (approx. 65–75 km to Darjeeling by road); Darjeeling has the narrow gauge Darjeeling Himalayan Railway (toy train) linking NJP / Siliguri region via Ghum.
nearest_bus: Darjeeling Bus Stand (local / regional buses from Siliguri/NJP).
nearest_airport: Bagdogra Airport (IXB) near Siliguri (approx. 70–80 km by road to Darjeeling).
metro_station: No metro (nearest urban rail at Siliguri/NJP region).
accessibility: Mountain roads; steep terrain; good road connectivity from Siliguri; narrow gauge toy train available (subject to weather & service). Wheelchair access limited in many spots; some gardens/parks have paved paths.
guided_tours: Local guides, tea garden tours, heritage railway rides, trekking guides for nearby trails.
parking: City/stand parking available; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Tea estates, cafes, hotels, viewpoints, museums (Himalayan Mountaineering Institute & Tibetology).
special_notes: Famous for panoramic views of the Himalaya (Kanchenjunga), colonial charm, tea plantations, and the UNESCO-listed Darjeeling Himalayan Railway (toy train).

timings: Trekking season windows; trails accessible March–May & Oct–Nov primarily; monsoon months risky.
entry_fee: Not documented (trek permits / guide/porter charges applicable for organized treks).
best_time: March–May & Oct–Nov (clear mountain views & favorable trekking weather).
nearest_railway: New Jalpaiguri (NJP) / Siliguri (approx. 70–90 km depending on trailhead).
nearest_bus: Manebhanjan (trek start) via shared jeeps from Siliguri/NJP.
nearest_airport: Bagdogra Airport (approx. 80–100 km to trailheads).
accessibility: High-altitude trekking with steep trails, uneven terrain — not wheelchair friendly; medium to hard difficulty depending on route.
guided_tours: Local guides and porters widely available; permits and local guide support recommended.
parking: Parking at Manebhanjan / trailhead villages; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Basic guesthouses in Manebhanjan, trekking huts at lower camps, tea houses on route.
official_website: Local trekking operator pages; Darjeeling tourism pages.
special_notes: Best panoramic Himalayan sunrise/sunset views including Everest, Kanchenjunga, Lhotse, Makalu on clear days; top trek in eastern India.

category: Cultural / University Town / Arts & Heritage / Festival Venue
timings: Institutions on academic schedule; tourist spots & museums timing: Not documented.
entry_fee: Not documented (some museums / Rabindra Bhavan may have fees).
best_time: November–February (pleasant weather and major festivals like Poush Mela in December).
nearest_railway: Bolpur Shantiniketan Railway Station (approx. 1–3 km).
nearest_bus: Bolpur Bus Stand (city; close by).
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport (approx. 150–180 km by road) / nearest domestic airports in Kolkata.
accessibility: Road & rail access good; heritage campus with walking areas — partial wheelchair access recommended to check per site.
guided_tours: Cultural walks and local guides available; many art & craft demonstrations and workshops.
parking: Local parking in Bolpur; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Guesthouses, local eateries, craft shops, cultural events.
special_notes: Founded by Rabindranath Tagore; center for arts, music, and Poush Mela/Visva-Bharati cultural festivals; UNESCO-recognised intangible cultural heritage (Bengal’s Durga Puja) relevance in region.

category: Historical / Temple Architecture / Terracotta Art Heritage
timings: Temples open during daylight; museum/offices timings: Not documented.
entry_fee: Not documented (some sites/museums may have entry fees).
best_time: October–March (comfortable weather; festivals like Gajan/Bishnupur Utsav).
nearest_railway: Bishnupur Railway Station (approx. 1–3 km).
nearest_bus: Bishnupur Bus Stand (city).
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport, Kolkata (approx. 150–170 km).
accessibility: Road access; historic temple complexes have steps & narrow courtyards — limited wheelchair access.
guided_tours: Local guides and heritage walks organized by district tourism.
parking: City parking close to major temple complexes; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Handicraft shops (Baluchari sarees), eateries, guesthouses.
special_notes: Famous for exquisite terracotta temples (Rasmancha, Jor Bangla temples), classical music (Bishnupur Gharana) and weaving tradition.

timings: Museum & palace opening hours: Not documented (typical daylight hours; verify locally).
entry_fee: Not documented (museum/palace entry fees may apply).
best_time: October–March (pleasant climate and festival times).
nearest_railway: Murshidabad Railway Station / Berhampore Court (approx. few km).
nearest_bus: Murshidabad / Berhampore bus stands (approx. few km).
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport (Kolkata) (approx. 200–240 km) / local airstrips limited.
accessibility: Road access from Kolkata; sites spread across historical town — mixed levels of accessibility; uneven surfaces in old quarter.
guided_tours: Local guides, heritage walks and river cruises available (Hindi/English).
parking: City/nearby parking in Berhampore; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Hotels, eateries, river ghats, souvenir shops.
official_website: Murshidabad heritage pages / ASI / district tourism pages.
special_notes: Former seat of Nawabs of Bengal with rich history, palaces, mosques, and the famous Hazarduari Palace museum (thousand doors).

timings: Beach open 24 hours (specific attractions/beachfront facilities follow daylight schedules).
entry_fee: Free (beach access). Specific amusement park/ride fees: Not documented.
best_time: October–February (pleasant coastal weather; avoid pre-monsoon storms).
nearest_railway: Digha Railway Station (approx. 1–5 km depending on area).
nearest_bus: Digha Bus Stand (city).
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport, Kolkata (approx. 180–200 km by road).
accessibility: Coastal roads; promenades & steps; wheelchair access limited depending on beach stretch.
guided_tours: Local beach activities & boat rides; local guides for nearby fishing villages.
parking: Beachfront parking available; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Resorts, hotels, seafood restaurants, stalls, restrooms.
official_website: West Bengal tourism pages covering Digha.
special_notes: Popular weekend beach destination from Kolkata; new sea-walks and family attractions; must check tide/weather for water activities.

timings: Beach open (daylight activities); resort & ride timings: Not documented.
entry_fee: Free (beach); water sports/resort charges vary — Not documented.
best_time: October–March (pleasant beach weather).
nearest_railway: Digha / Contai region stations (approx. 35–60 km depending on route) — exact nearest: Not documented.
nearest_bus: Local bus stops & private coach drops (distance varies).
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport (approx. 180–220 km).
accessibility: Coastal road access; long driveable beach stretches in some zones; wheel access limited on sand.
guided_tours: Local operators provide water sports, fishing tours, and village visits.
parking: Resort parking available; public parking Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Resorts, beach shacks, restaurants, restrooms.
official_website: West Bengal tourism pages & local resort sites.
special_notes: Emerging long sandy beach popular with weekenders and water-sports enthusiasts; less crowded than some mainstream beaches.

category: Wildlife Sanctuary / National Park / Rhino Reserve
timings: Park & safari timings seasonal — Not documented (park gates open during daylight; jeep/elephant safaris scheduled early morning/late afternoon).
entry_fee: Not documented (safari charges, entry fees & guide charges vary; book via forest dept).
best_time: November–April (dry season for wildlife sightings).
nearest_railway: New Mal Junction / Hasimara (approx. 20–40 km depending on entry).
nearest_bus: Alipurduar / Cooch Behar bus stands (distances vary).
nearest_airport: Bagdogra Airport (approx. 140–170 km depending on route).
accessibility: Road access via NH/SH; internal safari tracks; limited wheelchair access on uneven safari trails.
guided_tours: Forest department-trained guides and authorized safari operators available.
parking: Parking at park reception; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Forest lodges, eco-resorts, basic eateries in gateway towns.
official_website: West Bengal Forest / Jaldapara pages (state forest dept).
special_notes: Important one-horned rhino and elephant habitat; wildlife safaris and birdwatching are key draws.

timings: Park timings & safari schedules: Not documented (book via forest dept).
entry_fee: Not documented (jeep/elephant safari fees vary).
best_time: November–April (dry season, good for wildlife sightings).
nearest_railway: New Mal Junction / Bagdogra region stations (distance varies; Not documented precisely).
nearest_bus: Malbazar / Lataguri bus stops.
nearest_airport: Bagdogra Airport (approx. 80–120 km depending on gateway town).
accessibility: Road access; safari tracks; limited wheelchair access in wild zones.
guided_tours: Forest department guides; wildlife lodges arrange guided tours.
parking: Park parking near reception; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Eco-lodges, tea garden tours, eateries.
special_notes: Known for Indian bison (gaur), elephant and birdlife; good for short wildlife safaris from Dooars region.

timings: Palace visiting hours: Not documented.

nearest_airport: Bagdogra Airport (approx. 120–150 km) / nearest regional airstrip: Not documented.

parking: City parking near palace; charges Not documented.

special_notes: Majestic royal palace influenced by European architecture; important princely-state heritage site.

entry_fee: Not documented (ASI site fees may apply).

nearest_railway: Malda Town Railway Station / Old Malda (approx. few km).
nearest_bus: Malda Bus Stand (city).
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport (approx. 300+ km) — nearest regional airports limited.
accessibility: Road access via NH/NH linkages; ruins may have uneven surfaces & steps; limited wheelchair access.
guided_tours: Local guides and ASI-led information at major ruins.
parking: Local parking near sites; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Hotels and eateries in Malda town; local markets.
special_notes: Historic medieval capital with ruins of mosques, palaces and archaeological significance (Gour/Adina Mosque).

timings: Park/trek windows seasonal — Not documented (monsoon closure possible).
entry_fee: Not documented (permits/guide charges may apply).
best_time: Oct–May (post-monsoon clear skies; birding season).
nearest_railway: New Jalpaiguri / Siliguri (road onward; approx. 80–120 km depending on approach).
nearest_bus: Algarah / Kalimpong / Gorubathan bus points (distances vary).
nearest_airport: Bagdogra Airport (approx. 90–120 km to park gates).
accessibility: Dense forest & trekking routes; uneven terrain; not wheelchair friendly.
guided_tours: Local trekking guides and forest guides available.
parking: Limited near trailheads; Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Basic lodges in Kalimpong/nearby villages; tea houses on approach.

category: Wildlife Sanctuary / Tiger Reserve / Historical Fort
timings: Park/safari timings seasonal — Not documented.
entry_fee: Not documented (safari/permit fees vary).
best_time: November–April (dry season for wildlife & trekking around fort).
nearest_railway: New Jaigaon / Alipurduar (approx. 10–30 km depending on entry).
nearest_bus: Local bus stands in Alipurduar region.
nearest_airport: Bagdogra Airport (approx. 140–180 km depending on route).
accessibility: Forest roads & trails; moderate trekking to the fort; not wheelchair friendly.
guided_tours: Forest guides and local trekking guides available.
parking: Local parking at entry points; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Forest rest houses, basic tourist lodges.
special_notes: Famous for wildlife, birding, and the historic Buxa Fort (WWII / colonial era significance) — great for combined history + nature trips.

category: Hill / Scenic Viewpoint / Rock Climbing / Hiking
timings: Daylight hours (sunrise to sunset) typically; exact opening/closing times: Not documented.
entry_fee: Free (no formal fee known for hill access).
best_time: October to February (pleasant weather, clearer views; avoid heavy monsoon when paths slippery).
nearest_railway: Joychandipahar Railway Station (approx. 1-2 km).
nearest_bus: Raghunathpur Bus Stand (approx. 4-6 km) / local buses from Purulia town.
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport, Kolkata (approx. 280-320 km depending on route).
accessibility: Via road from Purulia / Raghunathpur; trekking/hiking required for hilltop; rocky terrain; not wheelchair-friendly for summit section.
guided_tours: Local guides available; sometimes festival events like Joychandi Pahar Utsav attract organized groups.
parking: Local parking in foothill town (Raghunathpur / near base); charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Local shops, restaurants in Raghunathpur / Purulia; guesthouses; restrooms in town base.
special_notes: One of the most accessible hills for rock climbing near Purulia; scenic during sunrise/sunset; cultural festival around New Year; filming location for movies.

category: Hill / Outdoor Art / Nature / Cultural Tourism
timings: Daylight hours; no formal site hours documented for rock park & hilltop.
entry_fee: No formal fee documented.
best_time: October-March (post-monsoon clarity; avoid monsoon & slippery rock faces).
nearest_railway: Purulia Railway Station (approx. 50-km).
nearest_bus: Baghmundi / Charida bus stands (local road transport from Purulia town; approx. 10-15 km).
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport, Kolkata (approx. 300-320 km by road).
accessibility: Road till Charida; last stretch uphill/rocky; trekking/hiking required; not wheelchair-friendly.
guided_tours: Some local guides in Charida; artisan workshops (mask making) are part of visits.
parking: Local/basic parking near Charida village; charges Not known.
nearby_amenities: Villages with shops; workshops for Chhau mask artisans; small eateries; guest stays in nearby Purulia / Baghmundi.
special_notes: Known as “Bird Hill” due to rock murals of birds; combines nature, art, and tribal culture; connected to mask-making (Purulia Chhau) in Charida.

place_name: Muradih Dam & Boronti / Muradi Dam & Boranti
category: Dam / Reservoir / Scenic Picnic Spot / Natural Beauty
timings: Daylight hours; not a formally gated tourist park with fixed opening/closing times → Not documented.
entry_fee: None documented for general access.
best_time: October-February (cooler seasons; water levels good) / post-monsoon.
nearest_railway: Nearest major station: Purulia Railway Station (approx. 30-40 km depending on road).
nearest_bus: Purulia Bus Stand (city) plus vans / buses to the dam area; approx. 15-25 km from town.
nearest_airport: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport, Kolkata (approx. 280-320 km).
accessibility: Road to dam via local roads; roads may be rough in monsoon; arrival possible via personal vehicle; not fully wheelchair friendly near reservoir bank.
guided_tours: Not documented; local fishing / rural tourism guides maybe.
parking: Basic parking possible near the dam/reservoir; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Village shops, basic eateries; possibility of picnic usage; lodging in Purulia town.
wikipedia: Not a separate entry; dam-reservoir not fully documented on Wikipedia (No dedicated page) → so: Not documented.
special_notes: Scenic water body set among hillocks; less crowded; good for nature lovers & peaceful retreat; ideal for photographers and birdwatchers.
